name: MilkDrop Winamp Plug-in Preset
summary: Learn about .MILK files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Music visualization plug-ins and applications transform audio input into often-psychedelic animations that can be used as desktop wallpapers, screensavers, or videos. To transform audio input into video output, music visualization programs utilize preset files, which contain a variety of audio- and visual-related settings. For example, a preset file may specify what color waveforms appear in an animation.

MILK files are MilkDrop preset files. Using a variety of text-based settings, they determine how MilkDrop transforms audio input into animations. Different MILK files use different values for each setting, allowing MilkDrop to produce distinct visuals for the same piece of audio content.
NOTE: projectM's .PRJM files are very similar to MILK files.

instructions: To use a MILK file with MilkDrop or projectM, you must place the file in the programs' presets folder (or whichever folder you use to store presets). Then, you can select the MILK file as a preset in MilkDrop or projectM.
To use a MILK file with the Windows version of VideoLAN VLC media player:
Click the All button in the Show settings section.
Click the Browse... button next to the projectM preset path field.
Navigate to and select the folder containing your MILK file.
If you want to edit the settings a MILK file contains, you can do so by opening and editing the file in any text editor, such as Microsoft Notepad, Apple TextEdit, or GitHub Atom.
